main event: A civilian observed a silver colored saucer with lit windows in St. Augustine, Florida in December 1952.
interesting points: The object had 5 or 6 windows illuminated with white lights., The outer rim of the saucer was spinning while emitting a humming sound., A bluish flame burned at the rear, which later changed to a bright red flame., The saucer traveled at a terrific speed across the sky after being visible for about 10 seconds., The report suggests that the observed phenomena might be attributed to a meteor, despite an insufficient data classification.
witness description: The witness was a civilian male, age 35 at the time of reporting.
